title: How to know if a girl wants me to make the first move - Quora

response.answer_text: Looking back, it’s obvious to me. In some sense (not scientific), they get in your face. They are always around. They tease you (nicely) or make fun of you (nicely), they talk to you when they could talk to someone else. They ask you stupid questions, “What’s your favorite movie?” or “Do you like dogs?” They ENGAGE you in a way the others aren’t. The pester you. They get under your skin or into your consciousness. It’s instinctive. You have this sudden realization that they’re always around, paying attention to you, and you realize they’ve filled your mind for no reason you can think of. While you’d barely noticed them before or had kind-of admired them from afar, now you’re strangely but intensely aware of them. Women make “the first move.” Men never do. The woman always makes the first move — not practically or politically, but biologically. They guy’s job is to pick up on this and respond — not with passionate kisses, but with the realization that you’ve been selected, and YOUR first move is to respond. In days of old, that would be asking her for a “date,” and by that time, you’d know she’d say “OK.” Since she’s selected you , you know she’ll say yes. Then you worry about the date, how to act, etc. I suppose nobody cares about that anymore. But the point that is timeless is: She selected you as “the first move” got into your face, and made you notice her. It’s her invitation for YOU to make what you think is “your first move.” Which is really the second move, but whatever.Make your first move. Ask her out or whatever they do now. Just the two of you, a movie, lunch, a walk, come over to watch a movie, whatever.My specifics are out of date, but the INSTINCTS are never out of date.

I’m now married so my advise may no longer be relevant, but when I was dating I would always appreciate it when a woman made the first move. I can see how in today’s climate of sexual assault accusations that it may become the norm for women to HAVE to make the first move lest the man feel like he will be shamed for all eternity if he miscalculates and moves in for a kiss and the women is not reciprocating his feelings. I think it should be pretty easy for a woman to comprehend a man’s body language to tell if he’s interested in her (at least physically). Men are usually not subtle, or even gentlemanly and suave, about things and will make it easy for a woman to understand if there’s interest on his part. There was only one time where I was dating a girl and she miscalculated her move (went in eyes closed for a kiss totally out of nowhere). I still went with it. I didn’t put my hand on her shoulder and say, “Whoa…what are you DOING?!” I still went with the moment despite feeling awkward. But all the other times where the girl I was dating went for the first move, it was awesome. There were times I made the first move too, but I have no idea if the girl thought it was awesome or not. You put a lot on the line, making the first move. Just throwing your chin out there. So it takes a gut check and surety of ego to have the confidence to make the first move. For guys it’s a lot different…more difficult to read the seemingly imperceptible signs of a woman’s level of interest. For women making the first move, it should be simple as long as she isn’t reading too much into things. Women have a tendency to over-analyze situations and turn irrelevant things into things of importance. Also factor in the climate of sexual harassment claims and a potential for general hesitancy of males to make the first move—like I said, I have been out of the dating scene now since 2006, so my experiences may no longer hold any relevance.
